answer_options.A: That's why starting a recycling program would help our school stay clean and protect the environment.
answer_options.B: Many other schools in our state already have recycling bins.
answer_options.C: That's why we should throw away less trash in the cafeteria.
answer_options.D: Recycling is important because the Earth is our planet.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it restates the opinion that the school should start a recycling program and effectively summarizes the two key reasons presented: keeping the school clean and protecting the environment. A strong concluding statement reinforces the main argument without introducing new information or focusing on only one minor detail.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice describes a writing task that takes place over an extended time frame with time for research and revision?

answer_options.A: A journal entry written in one sitting
answer_options.B: A science project report created over several days with research and revision
answer_options.C: A message written to a friend during recess
answer_options.D: A set of math problems answered on a worksheet

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it describes writing over an extended time frame (several days) that includes time for research and revision, which aligns with the standard for writing routinely over longer periods.
subject: ELA

question:
Mr. Park's class has four writing tasks this week:
1) A science report about local birds that requires research, rough drafts, and final illustrations.
2) A thank-you note to the librarian who visited the class today.
3) A how-to guide explaining addition strategies for a second-grade reading buddy.
4) A journal entry reflecting on yesterday's field trip.

Which choice describes a writing plan that uses both extended time frames and shorter time frames for these different tasks?

answer_options.A: Spend three days on the science report—research birds, write a draft, revise, and add illustrations. Write the thank-you note immediately after the librarian's visit today. Complete the how-to guide during one math period. Jot the journal entry in ten minutes before dismissal.
answer_options.B: Spend three full days on each task, researching and revising every piece thoroughly before moving to the next one.
answer_options.C: Finish all four tasks in one hour today without planning or revising any of them.
answer_options.D: Work only on the science report all week because it is the most important; skip the thank-you note, how-to guide, and journal.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates routine writing over an extended time frame for the science report (allowing time for research, reflection, and revision) while also completing three different pieces—the thank-you note, how-to guide, and journal entry—within shorter time frames or single sittings, showing variety in tasks and purposes.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a student meeting the goal of writing regularly by using both short periods and longer periods with time for research and revision?

answer_options.A: Zoe spends two weeks researching and revising a science report, but she does not complete any short writing assignments.
answer_options.B: Ryan writes a thank-you note to his aunt in one sitting. He also spends five days researching, writing, and revising an animal report to share with his classmates.
answer_options.C: Emma writes a journal entry every morning in ten minutes, but she never works on longer writing projects.
answer_options.D: Noah copies spelling words each day and finishes them quickly, but he does not write any stories or reports.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows the student completing a short writing task in one sitting (the thank-you note) and also working on a longer project over several days that includes research and revision before sharing with an audience (the animal report), demonstrating writing routinely over both shorter and extended time frames.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best introduces a paragraph about caring for a pet dog?

answer_options.A: Pet dogs need food, water, and exercise to stay healthy.
answer_options.B: My puppy barked loudly at the mail carrier yesterday.
answer_options.C: Dogs are mammals with fur and four legs.
answer_options.D: There are many different breeds of dogs in the world.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it introduces the topic of caring for a pet dog and groups related information together by listing the main needs—food, water, and exercise—to tell the reader what the paragraph will explain.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is writing an informational report about how seeds travel to new places to grow. The student has these notes:
• Maple seeds spin like helicopters in the wind.
• Dandelion seeds float on breezes for miles.
• Burdock seeds stick to deer fur and fall off later.
• Squirrels bury acorns and sometimes forget where.
• Coconut seeds drift across oceans on currents.
• Some berries pass through birds and sprout where dropped.

Which choice BEST follows the rule: "Introduce a topic and group related information together"?

answer_options.A: Begin with: "Plants make seeds." Then group the notes into (1) "Seeds in the Air" (maple, dandelion) and (2) "Other Seeds" (burdock, squirrels, coconut, berries).
answer_options.B: Begin with: "Seeds have clever ways to travel to new homes." Then group the notes into (1) "Seeds and Animals" (burdock, squirrels, berries, maple) and (2) "Seeds and Water" (coconut, dandelion).
answer_options.C: Begin with: "Maple seeds spin like helicopters." Then group the notes into (1) "Moving with Wind" (maple, dandelion), (2) "Moving with Animals" (burdock, squirrels, berries), and (3) "Floating on Water" (coconut).
answer_options.D: Begin with: "Seeds cannot walk, but they use wind, water, and animals to travel to new growing spots." Then group the notes into (1) "Flying on Wind" (maple, dandelion), (2) "Traveling with Animals" (burdock, squirrels, berries), and (3) "Drifting on Water" (coconut).

answer_explanation: Option D is correct because it opens with a broad sentence that clearly introduces the topic of seed dispersal, and it groups every related detail into logical categories—wind, animals, and water—keeping all notes about each travel method together.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informational report about thunderstorms. Which opening paragraph BEST introduces the topic and groups related information together?

answer_options.A: I saw an amazing thunderstorm last night! The lightning was bright purple and my whole family watched from the porch. We counted the seconds between the lightning and thunder.
answer_options.B: Thunderstorms are powerful weather events that bring lightning, thunder, and heavy rain. This report explains how these storms form, why they can be dangerous, and ways to stay safe during one.
answer_options.C: Thunderstorms are loud and scary. Lightning comes first. Then thunder rumbles. Rain falls hard. Storms happen in spring and summer.
answer_options.D: Different kinds of weather happen every day. Some days are sunny and warm. Other days bring snow or wind. Weather is interesting to study.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it introduces the topic of thunderstorms and groups related information together by previewing three organized categories: how the storms form, their dangers, and safety steps.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the topic sentence below. Which choice best develops this topic by adding a factual detail about honeybees?

Topic: Honeybees are important insects that live in large groups called colonies.

answer_options.A: I think honeybees are scary and I do not like them.
answer_options.B: A single colony can have up to 60,000 bees living and working together.
answer_options.C: Honeybees are the best insects in the whole world.
answer_options.D: Honey tastes very sweet on warm toast.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it provides a specific factual detail about the size of a honeybee colony, which develops the topic by explaining what the large groups are like.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informative paragraph about desert animals. The topic sentence is: "Desert animals have special adaptations to survive extreme heat." Which sentence best develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: The fennec fox is a nocturnal mammal with oversized ears that release body heat, and it hunts when temperatures drop below 70 degrees.
answer_options.B: Desert animals are the most fascinating creatures on Earth because they manage to survive in extremely harsh and challenging conditions.
answer_options.C: Certain animals rest in cool burrows during the hot day and emerge to search for food when darkness brings cooler air.
answer_options.D: Rainforest animals inhabit wet tropical environments where they climb tall trees to locate fresh fruit and build secure nests.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it develops the topic by providing a definition of the fennec fox as a nocturnal mammal, a factual statement about its oversized ears releasing body heat, and a specific detail about hunting when temperatures drop below 70 degrees.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informative paragraph about the Arctic. Which sentence BEST develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: The Arctic is the coldest and most interesting place on Earth.
answer_options.B: The Arctic is a polar region located at the northernmost part of Earth that is covered in ice and snow for most of the year.
answer_options.C: I read a book about Arctic animals during library time yesterday.
answer_options.D: We should all work together to protect the Arctic environment.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it provides a definition of the Arctic (a polar region at the northernmost part of Earth) and includes specific factual details about its ice and snow coverage, which develops the topic with concrete information rather than opinions or personal experiences.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence uses a linking word to connect ideas?

answer_options.A: I like to play soccer. I like to play basketball.
answer_options.B: I like to play soccer. Also, I like to play basketball.
answer_options.C: I like to play soccer. Yesterday I like to play basketball.
answer_options.D: I like to play soccer. Happy I like to play basketball.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses the linking word 'Also' to connect the idea of playing soccer with the idea of playing basketball, showing that both activities are enjoyed.
subject: ELA

question:
Read this draft of an informational paragraph. Which choice best revises sentence 3 to use a linking word or phrase that connects ideas within the SAME category?

Draft:
1) Community helpers make our town better.
2) Firefighters put out fires and save people.
3) They teach families about fire safety.
4) Police officers keep neighborhoods safe.

answer_options.A: Also, they teach families about fire safety.
answer_options.B: However, they teach families about fire safety.
answer_options.C: Police officers also teach families about fire safety.
answer_options.D: Afterwards, they teach families about fire safety.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses the linking word 'Also' to add another detail about firefighters, connecting ideas within the same category of community helpers. The linking word signals that teaching fire safety is an additional responsibility of the firefighters mentioned in sentence 2, maintaining focus on that specific group.
subject: ELA

question: Which option uses a linking word to connect the ideas by adding information?

answer_options.A: Elephants are the largest land animals. They have long trunks.
answer_options.B: Elephants are the largest land animals, but they have long trunks.
answer_options.C: Elephants are the largest land animals. Also, they have long trunks.
answer_options.D: Elephants are the largest land animals. They live in Africa and Asia.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it uses the linking word 'Also' to connect the first idea about elephants being the largest land animals to the second idea about them having long trunks, showing that the second detail adds information to the first.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph. Which sentence is the best conclusion?

Rain is important for plants and animals. It gives water to rivers and lakes. Rain also helps crops grow so we have food to eat.

answer_options.A: Rain falls from clouds in the sky.
answer_options.B: That is why rain is so important to everyone.
answer_options.C: Some places get more rain than others.
answer_options.D: Umbrellas keep people dry in the rain.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it summarizes the main idea that rain is important and provides a closing statement that wraps up the paragraph. A strong conclusion restates the central point and signals the end of the text.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below.

"Rain gardens are special areas planted with native flowers and grasses that soak up stormwater. When rain falls on roads and driveways, it picks up pollution and flows into drains that lead directly to rivers and lakes. A rain garden acts like a sponge, catching this runoff and filtering it through the soil before it reaches waterways. By capturing water that would otherwise cause flooding, these gardens also protect neighborhoods from erosion and property damage."

Which choice would be the most effective concluding statement for this paragraph?

answer_options.A: In addition, many butterflies and bees visit the colorful flowers in rain gardens during summer months.
answer_options.B: Overall, rain gardens are valuable tools that clean polluted water and prevent flooding in communities.
answer_options.C: For instance, the city of Portland, Oregon has installed hundreds of rain gardens along its streets.
answer_options.D: Next, we will learn how to build a simple rain barrel to collect water for your own backyard.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it synthesizes the paragraph’s central ideas—that rain gardens filter polluted water and prevent flooding—providing a clear sense of closure without introducing new information or shifting to a different topic.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. Which choice would be the best concluding statement for this paragraph?

"Every fall, monarch butterflies travel thousands of miles to warmer climates. They fly in large groups to find safe places to spend the winter. During the journey, they rest on trees and drink nectar from flowers. This migration helps the butterfly population survive cold weather."

answer_options.A: Monarch butterflies are orange and black with white spots on their wings.
answer_options.B: In conclusion, the monarch migration is an amazing journey that helps these insects survive.
answer_options.C: Other insects, like ladybugs, also travel to warmer places during winter.
answer_options.D: Butterflies begin their lives as tiny eggs laid on milkweed leaves.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it summarizes the main idea about monarch butterflies migrating to survive and provides a sense of closure to the paragraph without introducing new information.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best begins a story by introducing who is telling the story and what is happening?

answer_options.A: The museum was filled with ancient artifacts.
answer_options.B: I am Jake, and today I will explore a dark cave.
answer_options.C: Wow, look at that huge dinosaur!
answer_options.D: The hiking trail wound through the dense forest.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it introduces the narrator ('I am Jake') and establishes the situation ('today I will explore a dark cave'), clearly showing who is telling the story and what is happening.
subject: ELA

question: Which opening best establishes a situation and introduces the narrator or character(s)?

answer_options.A: Ancient trees towered overhead, their branches weaving a thick green canopy that blocked the afternoon sun completely.
answer_options.B: My heart always pounds with excitement whenever I think about exploring new places and discovering hidden treasures.
answer_options.C: During yesterday’s sudden power outage, my little brother and I huddled under a blanket with a flashlight, listening to the wind howl outside our window.
answer_options.D: Jax reached for the heavy backpack, his fingers brushing against the rough canvas as he prepared for the long journey ahead.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it clearly establishes the situation by providing a specific time marker (yesterday) and context (a sudden power outage and storm), and it introduces both the narrator and a character (my little brother and I) who are actively involved in the scene.
subject: ELA

question: Which opening best establishes a situation and introduces the narrator or characters?

answer_options.A: The old house at the end of the street stood silent and dark behind tall trees.
answer_options.B: My dog barks loudly whenever the mail carrier walks up to our front porch.
answer_options.C: Last Tuesday, my sister and I decided to build a fort in the backyard before lunch.
answer_options.D: Building forts is a fun activity that children enjoy on rainy days indoors.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it establishes the situation by telling when (last Tuesday) and where (the backyard) the story takes place, introduces the narrator and a character (my sister and I), and begins a natural sequence of events (deciding to build a fort).
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best uses dialogue and a description of an action to show how a character feels?

answer_options.A: "I won!" yelled Sara, waving her ribbon in the air.
answer_options.B: Sara was happy that she won the race.
answer_options.C: Sara ran as fast as she could.
answer_options.D: Sara felt proud of her ribbon.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses dialogue ("I won!") and describes an action (waving her ribbon in the air) to show Sara's excitement, demonstrating the narrative technique of combining character speech with descriptive details.
subject: ELA

question:
Leo was pumping hard as he rode up the steep hill when his bike chain suddenly snapped. He skidded to a stop.

Which option BEST uses dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, or feelings to develop the event and show Leo’s response?

answer_options.A: "No, not now!" Leo groaned, kicking at the loose chain while his chest heaved from the climb.
answer_options.B: Leo felt frustrated and worried that he would be late.
answer_options.C: "The chain broke," Leo said.
answer_options.D: Leo got off his bike and started walking up the hill.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses dialogue ("No, not now!") along with descriptions of Leo’s actions and physical feelings (groaning, kicking at the loose chain, chest heaving) to show his frustrated response to the broken chain.
subject: ELA

question: Which option BEST shows what a character says and does in a situation?

answer_options.A: "I can't find my dog," whispered Lily, biting her lip and glancing around the yard.
answer_options.B: "I can't find my dog," whispered Lily.
answer_options.C: Lily bit her lip and glanced around the yard.
answer_options.D: Lily was worried because she could not find her dog.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it includes dialogue ("I can't find my dog,") and describes the character's actions (biting her lip and glancing around the yard), showing both what Lily says and how she responds to the situation.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best completes the sentence to show the order of events?

"First, we planted the seeds. ________, we watered them."

answer_options.A: Next
answer_options.B: However
answer_options.C: Yesterday
answer_options.D: Because

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because "Next" is a temporal word that signals the immediate following action in a sequence, showing that watering the seeds happened after planting them.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph. It has four blanks.

[1] ________, the baker mixed the flour and sugar.
[2] ________, she added eggs and milk to the bowl.
[3] ________, she poured the batter into a pan.
[4] ________, she placed the cake in the oven.

Which choice of temporal words or phrases BEST completes blanks [1]–[4] so the events are shown in clear time order?

answer_options.A: First, Next, Then, Finally
answer_options.B: Initially, Subsequently, Meanwhile, Eventually
answer_options.C: First, Later, After that, Earlier
answer_options.D: To start with, Then, Then, At last

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses a distinct temporal word for each step to clearly signal chronological order: "First" establishes the beginning, "Next" and "Then" indicate the following actions in sequence, and "Finally" marks the conclusion. This variety precisely orients the reader to the progression of events.
subject: ELA

question: Which option uses temporal words to show the correct order of events?

answer_options.A: Spread the peanut butter on the bread because you are hungry.
answer_options.B: First, get two slices of bread; next, spread peanut butter on one slice; finally, put the slices together.
answer_options.C: You need bread and peanut butter and a knife.
answer_options.D: Although you have bread, you need peanut butter.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses the temporal words 'First,' 'next,' and 'finally' to clearly signal the beginning, middle, and end of the sequence in chronological order.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best gives this story a sense of closure?

Tomas was nervous about riding his bike without training wheels. His dad held the seat steady as he pedaled down the driveway. Soon, Tomas felt the wind on his face and realized he was riding alone.

answer_options.A: The bicycle had a shiny red bell.
answer_options.B: His dad ran alongside him holding the seat tightly.
answer_options.C: Tomas rode to the corner store to buy a snack.
answer_options.D: Tomas stopped at the end of the driveway and grinned at his dad.

answer_explanation: Option D is correct because it shows the end of the bike ride and Tomas's happy reaction, which wraps up the story and tells the reader that the event is finished.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the story below. Which choice best gives this story a sense of closure?

"For weeks, Jenna had worked on her science project about volcanoes. She carefully painted the papier-mâché mountain and mixed baking soda for the eruption. On presentation day, she stood nervously beside her display. When she poured in the vinegar, red foam bubbled over the top, and her classmates cheered."

answer_options.A: Jenna smiled, knowing all her hard work had paid off as she watched the foam spill onto the tray.
answer_options.B: The teacher then announced that next week they would start a unit on weather.
answer_options.C: Jenna wondered if she should add more red food coloring to make it look like lava.
answer_options.D: She quickly grabbed a paper towel to wipe up the spill before it reached the floor.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows Jenna reflecting on her success and signals that the presentation—and the story—has reached a satisfying conclusion. The character’s realization that her work paid off provides an emotional resolution and indicates the event is complete.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph.

Jada spent the afternoon building a birdhouse with her grandfather. She hammered the nails carefully and painted the roof bright blue. When they hung it in the oak tree, a small sparrow landed on the perch right away.

Which sentence best ends the paragraph and gives it a sense of closure?

answer_options.A: Jada smiled, knowing the birds had a safe new home because of her hard work.
answer_options.B: Next week, Jada planned to build a feeder for the squirrels in the yard.
answer_options.C: The birdhouse was constructed from cedar wood with a circular entrance hole.
answer_options.D: Would other birds visit the birdhouse now that it was finished and hung?

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it reflects on the completed birdhouse and expresses Jada's satisfaction, effectively wrapping up the narrative and signaling that the story has reached its conclusion.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a thank-you note to your teacher for helping you learn fractions. Which choice is the most appropriate way to begin the note?

answer_options.A: Hey teacher, thanks for the math help.
answer_options.B: Dear Ms. Johnson, Thank you for helping me learn fractions.
answer_options.C: Yesterday I went to the park with my friends.
answer_options.D: Math is too hard for me to learn.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses an appropriate formal greeting for a teacher and clearly states the purpose of thanking them for the specific help, which matches the task and audience of a thank-you note.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a formal letter to the mayor of your city to request a new playground in your neighborhood. Which choice is most appropriate for this task, purpose, and audience?

answer_options.A: Hello Mayor Johnson, Our playground is really old and not very good anymore. Kids in my neighborhood don't have anywhere fun to play after school. Can you please build us a new one? Thanks! Your friend, Alex
answer_options.B: Dear Mayor Johnson: I am writing to request a new playground for Maple Street Park. The current equipment is unsafe and outdated. A new playground would provide a safe place for children to exercise. Please consider this request. Sincerely, Alex Johnson
answer_options.C: Dear Mayor Johnson, I want to tell you that the swings are broken. Also, the slide is rusty and the monkey bars are wobbly. Please fix all of this equipment for us soon. From, Alex
answer_options.D: Once upon a time, there was a broken swing at the park that no one could use. One day, a girl named Alex decided to write to the mayor. 'We need a new playground,' she said. The end.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses a formal greeting and closing appropriate for writing to a public official, clearly states the request, provides organized supporting reasons, and maintains a respectful tone throughout, making it suitable for the task, purpose, and audience.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a letter to your school principal to ask for a new basketball hoop on the playground. Which choice shows writing that is appropriate for this task and audience?

answer_options.A: Dear Principal Martinez, I am writing to ask if our school could get a new basketball hoop. Many students enjoy playing basketball at recess, but the current hoop is broken. Thank you for considering my request. Sincerely, [Name]
answer_options.B: Hey Principal! The basketball hoop is really old and broken. We need a new one right now. Thanks.
answer_options.C: I do not like the playground because the basketball hoop is in bad shape. You need to replace it immediately.
answer_options.D: Dear Principal Martinez, I like to play basketball with my friends. It is my favorite game to play at home.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses a polite and respectful tone suitable for writing to a principal, clearly states the request, provides a brief reason, and includes an appropriate greeting and closing. This matches the formal task of writing to a school leader.
subject: ELA

question: After writing a story, Sam shares his draft with his teacher. She suggests he add more details about the setting and fix his spelling. Which choice describes what Sam is doing?

answer_options.A: Planning ideas before writing
answer_options.B: Revising and editing with guidance
answer_options.C: Publishing the final copy immediately
answer_options.D: Reading a book for pleasure

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because Sam is using feedback from his teacher (guidance) to add details and correct spelling, which are revision and editing steps that strengthen his writing.
subject: ELA

question:
Maya wrote this draft about her morning:

"My little brother was sad. He lost his toy. He sat on the step. He cried."

Her classmate said, "Show me exactly what your brother did instead of just telling me he was sad." Her teacher added, "Your sentences are choppy. Combine some of them to help the story flow, and check your capitals and punctuation."

Which choice best shows Maya developing and strengthening her writing by planning, revising, and editing with this guidance?

answer_options.A: Create a brief outline (problem, action, solution); rewrite to combine "He sat on the step" and "He cried" into "He sat on the step with tears rolling down his cheeks," and change "was sad" to show his shoulders slumping and lip trembling; then check all capitals and periods.
answer_options.B: Combine "He sat on the step" and "He cried" into one longer sentence, but keep "was sad" as is and do not check capitalization or punctuation.
answer_options.C: Add intensifier words like "very" and "really" to describe the sadness and crying, but leave all four sentences separate and short, and skip editing capitals.
answer_options.D: Only capitalize the first word and add a period at the very end, leaving the sentences short and choppy and keeping "was sad" without showing specific actions.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates all three stages of strengthening writing: planning (creating an outline), revising (combining choppy sentences and showing the brother's feelings through specific descriptive actions rather than simply stating he was sad), and editing (checking capitalization and punctuation).
subject: ELA

question:
During writing workshop, Mr. Lee suggests that Aisha strengthen her draft by combining short sentences and adding descriptive words. Read this sentence from Aisha's draft:

'The cat sat. The cat was fluffy. The cat purred.'

Which revision shows Aisha following her teacher's advice?

answer_options.A: The cat sat, and the cat was fluffy, and the cat purred.
answer_options.B: The fluffy cat sat on the sofa and purred softly.
answer_options.C: The Cat sat. It was fluffy. It purred.
answer_options.D: The cat sat down. The cat was very fluffy. The cat purred loudly.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it strengthens the writing by combining the three short, choppy sentences into one smooth sentence and adding descriptive details (fluffy, on the sofa, softly) that paint a clearer picture for the reader.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows using technology to produce and publish writing with help from a teacher?

answer_options.A: Writing a story with a pencil and putting it in your desk
answer_options.B: Typing a story on a computer and posting it on the class website
answer_options.C: Drawing a picture about your favorite animal and hanging it on the wall
answer_options.D: Telling a story out loud to a friend during lunch

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows using technology (typing on a computer) to produce the writing and publishing it by sharing it on the class website where others can see it.
subject: ELA

question: Which scenario best demonstrates a third-grader meeting the standard to use technology—with guidance from adults—to produce and publish writing while also collaborating with others?

answer_options.A: After her teacher suggests a topic, Maya types a story on the classroom tablet, shares the draft with a partner for revisions, and posts the final version on the class website for families to read.
answer_options.B: During free time, Jake types a poem on the library computer and saves it to his student folder without sharing it with anyone.
answer_options.C: At home without asking an adult, Leo records a video of himself reading a handwritten story and uploads it to a public video site.
answer_options.D: With help from her teacher, Ava handwrites a letter to the principal and delivers it to the school office.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it demonstrates using technology and keyboarding skills to produce writing, receiving guidance and support from an adult when the teacher suggests the topic, collaborating with a peer during revisions, and publishing the final work by posting it on the class website.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a third-grader using technology to produce and publish writing with guidance from an adult?

answer_options.A: Writing a story by hand in a journal and reading it aloud to a friend.
answer_options.B: Typing a report on a tablet and printing one copy for the teacher.
answer_options.C: Typing a poem on a computer, posting it on the class blog with the teacher's help, and reading comments from family.
answer_options.D: Drawing a picture on a tablet and sending it to a cousin by email.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it shows the student using technology (typing on a computer) to produce writing, publishing it by posting on the class blog, and receiving guidance from an adult (the teacher's help), which aligns with the standard.
subject: ELA

question: Which activity shows a student conducting a short research project to build knowledge about a topic?

answer_options.A: Writing a fictional story about a talking dog
answer_options.B: Looking up facts about butterflies in a library book and writing them down
answer_options.C: Asking a friend what they think about butterflies
answer_options.D: Coloring a picture of a butterfly without reading anything

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because conducting a short research project involves gathering information about a topic from sources like books and recording the facts to build knowledge.
subject: ELA

question: Four students are planning short research projects about space exploration. Which student's plan BEST shows how to conduct research that builds knowledge about a specific topic?

answer_options.A: I will search 'space' on the internet and copy the first five paragraphs I find into my report.
answer_options.B: I will ask my dad what he knows about rockets and write down his answers.
answer_options.C: I will read two library books about the Apollo 11 mission, watch a NASA video, and take notes to create a timeline of the first moon landing.
answer_options.D: I will check out 20 books about planets, stars, galaxies, and astronauts to read cover-to-cover before choosing a topic.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it demonstrates a focused research project on a specific topic (Apollo 11 mission), uses multiple credible sources (two library books and a NASA video), involves active note-taking, and synthesizes the information into an organized product (a timeline). This approach effectively builds knowledge through research.
subject: ELA

question: Sofia wants to learn about how honeybees help plants grow. Which choice shows the best way for her to begin a short research project that builds knowledge about this topic?

answer_options.A: She asks her little brother what he thinks bees do and writes a report based only on his guess.
answer_options.B: She reads two books about bees from the school library, watches a short educational video, and writes down three new facts she learned.
answer_options.C: She draws a colorful picture of a bee on a flower without reading any information.
answer_options.D: She copies a paragraph about bees from the internet and turns it in as her work.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because Sofia uses multiple reliable sources (books and a video) and records specific new information, which are essential steps in conducting a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic.
subject: ELA

question: Sara is writing a report about whales. She took brief notes from a library book. She needs to sort her notes into categories. Which choice belongs in the 'Food' category?

answer_options.A: Whales live in the ocean.
answer_options.B: Whales eat small fish and krill.
answer_options.C: Whales are the largest animals.
answer_options.D: Whales swim in groups called pods.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the note about whales eating small fish and krill describes what whales eat, which fits the 'Food' category. Sorting notes from sources into categories is part of good research.
subject: ELA

question: While researching animal survival, a student used a library book, a digital article, and personal observation. The teacher provided three categories for sorting evidence: 1) Physical Adaptations, 2) Food Gathering, and 3) Seasonal Behaviors. Which choice shows notes that BEST follow standard W.3.8 for gathering information and sorting evidence?

answer_options.A: The library book explained that snowshoe hares turn white in winter. The online article stated that bears sleep in dens during cold months. Yesterday I watched a squirrel bury a nut in my yard.
answer_options.B: 1) Physical: Book—Hares turn white in winter; 2) Food: Article—Squirrels bury nuts, My observation—I watched a squirrel bury food; 3) Behaviors: Article—Bears sleep in dens
answer_options.C: Library book: Hares turn white; Online article: Squirrels bury nuts, Bears sleep in dens; My observation: Squirrel buried food
answer_options.D: 1) Physical: Hares turn white (no source listed); 2) Food: Squirrels bury nuts (no source listed); 3) Behaviors: Bears sleep (no source listed)

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it presents brief notes rather than copied sentences, clearly identifies each source including the personal observation ('My observation'), and accurately sorts specific evidence into all three provided categories. This demonstrates the W.3.8 skills of gathering information from multiple sources, recalling information from experience, taking brief notes, and sorting evidence into categories.
subject: ELA

question:
Mia is writing a report about how animals find food. She gathered facts from a book and a website, and she recalled watching birds in her garden. She wrote these brief notes:

1. "Robins pull worms out of the ground after it rains. (my own observation)"
2. "Honeybees tell other bees where flowers are by dancing. (Busy Bugs, p. 5)"
3. "Spiders spin webs to catch insects. (NatureKids.com)"

Her teacher gave her two categories: "How Animals Communicate" and "How Animals Hunt or Gather Food."

Which choice shows the best way for Mia to sort her notes?

answer_options.A: Put note 2 in "How Animals Communicate" and notes 1 and 3 in "How Animals Hunt or Gather Food."
answer_options.B: Put all three notes in "How Animals Hunt or Gather Food."
answer_options.C: Put note 2 in "How Animals Hunt or Gather Food" and notes 1 and 3 in "How Animals Communicate."
answer_options.D: Put all three notes in "How Animals Communicate."

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it correctly sorts the note about honeybees communicating through dance into the "How Animals Communicate" category and the notes about robins and spiders gathering food into the "How Animals Hunt or Gather Food" category, demonstrating how to organize evidence gathered from print and digital sources as well as personal experience into the provided categories.
subject: ELA
